type.name: section
type.title: 1.Short title.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 1.Short title.1. This Act may be cited as the Summary Jurisdiction(Lay Magistrates) Act.
type.description: This Act may be cited as the Summary Jurisdiction(Lay Magistrates) Act.

type.name: section
type.title: 2.Lay magistrates' courts.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 2.Lay magistrates' courts.2. (1) There shall be established such number of laymagistrates courts as the Minister, after consultation with theChancellor, may determine.(2) A lay magistrates court shall be presided over bya person to be called a lay magistrate and shall, in accordancewith the provisions of this Act, exercise both criminal andcivil jurisdiction.

description.description: There shall be established such number of laymagistrates courts as the Minister, after consultation with theChancellor, may determine.(2) A lay magistrates court shall be presided over bya person to be called a lay magistrate and shall, in accordancewith the provisions of this Act, exercise both criminal andcivil jurisdiction.

type.name: section
type.title: 3.Assignment of lay magistrates.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 3.Assignment of lay magistrates.3.Every lay magistrate shall have jurisdictionthroughout Guyana and may be assigned to any magisterialdistrict by the Chancellor.
type.description: 3.Every lay magistrate shall have jurisdictionthroughout Guyana and may be assigned to any magisterialdistrict by the Chancellor.

type.name: section
type.title: 4.Qualification for appointment as a lay magistrate.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 4.Qualification for appointment as a lay magistrate.4. A person shall be qualified to be appointed a laymagistrate if he is a fit and proper person with at least sevenyears experience in a senior position in a public sector orprivate sector field of activity.
type.description: A person shall be qualified to be appointed a laymagistrate if he is a fit and proper person with at least sevenyears experience in a senior position in a public sector orprivate sector field of activity.

type.name: section
type.title: 6.Clerk.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 6.Clerk.6.(1) There shall be appointed for every laymagistrates court a fit and proper person to be or to act asclerk of that court.(2) The clerk shall have such functions as may beprescribed by the Chancellor.(3) The clerk shall be subject to the generalsupervision and control of the Chancellor,  but shall be underthe immediate supervision of the lay magistrate presidingover the court of which he is the clerk.

type.name: section
type.title: 7.Qualifications for appointment as a Clerk.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 7.Qualifications for appointment as a Clerk.7. No person shall be appointed as a clerk to a laymagistrates court unless at the time of appointment he holdsa Bachelor of Laws degree of a university of anyCommonwealth country or any equivalent qualification or inthe opinion of the Chancellor is a fit and proper person to beappointed as a clerk.
type.description: No person shall be appointed as a clerk to a laymagistrates court unless at the time of appointment he holdsa Bachelor of Laws degree of a university of anyCommonwealth country or any equivalent qualification or inthe opinion of the Chancellor is a fit and proper person to beappointed as a clerk.

type.name: section
type.title: 8.Powers and duties of a clerk.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 8.Powers and duties of a clerk.8. (1) It is hereby declared that the functions of a clerkinclude the giving to the lay magistrate to whom he is clerk,as and when required by the lay magistrate, such advicewithin his competence about law, practice  or procedure onquestions arising in connection with the discharge of hisfunctions, and it shall be the duty of the clerk to bring to theattention of the lay magistrate any point  of law, practice orprocedure that is or may be involved in any questions soarising.(2) Without prejudice to subsection (1) the duties ofthe clerk, shall be such as may be assigned by the Chancellorand, where appropriate, shall include those duties specifiedunder section 23 of the Summary Jurisdiction (Magistrates)Act so far as those duties apply to the aforesaid clerk.

type.title: 9.Criminal jurisdiction of a lay magistrates' court.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 9.Criminal jurisdiction of a lay magistrates' court.9. type.name: section
type.title: 10.Summary trial of case.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 10.Summary trial of case.10. Where a person charged with committing anoffence stated by the enactment creating the offence to betriable summarily, a lay magistrates court, presided over by alay magistrate, may try such offence but the monetarypunishment therefor shall notexceed the punishmentmentioned in section 9 (1).

type.name: section
type.title: 11.Civil jurisdiction of a lay magistrates' court.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 11.Civil jurisdiction of a lay magistrates' court.11. A lay magistrates court may hear and determinecivil cases or matters where the subject matter in dispute, ifcapable of being estimated at a money value, does not exceedfifty thousand dollars.
type.description: A lay magistrates court may hear and determinecivil cases or matters where the subject matter in dispute, ifcapable of being estimated at a money value, does not exceedfifty thousand dollars.

type.name: section
type.title: 12.Area of jurisdiction.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 12.Area of jurisdiction.12. The jurisdiction of a lay magistrates court shallextend only to causes andmatters arising within themagisterial area of its jurisdiction.
type.description: The jurisdiction of a lay magistrates court shallextend only to causes andmatters arising within themagisterial area of its jurisdiction.

type.name: section
type.title: 13.Jurisdiction of a magistrates' court unaffected.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 13.Jurisdiction of a magistrates' court unaffected.13. Nothing in this Act shall affect or be deemed toaffect the jurisdiction of a magistrates court under theSummary Jurisdiction (Magistrates) Act.
type.description: Nothing in this Act shall affect or be deemed toaffect the jurisdiction of a magistrates court under theSummary Jurisdiction (Magistrates) Act.

type.name: section
type.title: 14.Promotion of reconciliation in criminal cases.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 14.Promotion of reconciliation in criminal cases.14. In all cases a lay magistrates court shall  promotereconciliation, and encourage and facilitate  the settlement inan amicable way, of  proceedings for common assault or forany other offence of a personal or private nature notamounting to felony and not aggravated in degree, on termsof payment of compensation or other terms approved by thecourt and may thereupon order the proceedings to be stayed.

type.name: section
type.title: 16.Adjournments.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 16.Adjournments.16. (1) Before or during the hearing of any case, laymagistrate may in his discretion adjourn the hearing subjectto the provisions of this section, to a time and place appointedby him in the presence and hearing of the parties or of theircounsel.(2) If a lay magistrate is not present at the time andplace of hearing, the clerk may, by public notice, written ororal, adjourn the sitting until such time and to such place asmay be stated in the notice and all persons bound to bepresent at the sitting so adjourned shall be equally bound tobe present at the time and  place appointed by such notice.(3) In the absence of a notice under subsection (2) allpersons bound to be present at the sitting shall be bound to bepresent at the next succeeding time appointed for the sittingof the court at the same place.(4) No adjournments under this section shall be formore than seven clear days.

type.name: section
type.title: 17.Sunday or public holidays.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 17.Sunday or public holidays.17. When any day appointed for the sitting oradjourned sitting of the court falls on a Sunday or a publicholiday, the court may if practicable sit on the day (not beinga public holiday) next after the day appointed for such sitting.
type.description: When any day appointed for the sitting oradjourned sitting of the court falls on a Sunday or a publicholiday, the court may if practicable sit on the day (not beinga public holiday) next after the day appointed for such sitting.

type.name: section
type.title: 18.Promotion of reconciliation in civil cases.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 18.Promotion of reconciliation in civil cases.18. (1) In civil causes or matters a lay magistrate shall,as far as there is proper opportunity, promote reconciliationamong persons over whom he has jurisdiction, and encourageand facilitate the settlement in an amicable way and withoutrecourse to litigation in the matters in dispute between them.

description.description: In civil causes or matters a lay magistrate shall,as far as there is proper opportunity, promote reconciliationamong persons over whom he has jurisdiction, and encourageand facilitate the settlement in an amicable way and withoutrecourse to litigation in the matters in dispute between them.

type.name: section
type.title: 20.Enforcement.
type.context: SUMMARY JURISDICTION (LAY MAGISTRATES) ACT under 20.Enforcement.20. (1) Where a lay magistrates court imposes a fineor gives judgement in a civil case but the fine  is not paidwithin the time allowed by the lay magistrate or the civiljudgement is not complied with, the lay magistrate shalltransfer the record of the proceedings to any magistrateholding a magistrates court in the said magisterial district inwhich the lay magistrate is holding court.(2) Upon receipt of the record of the proceedings, themagistrate shall instruct his clerk to stamp with stamp of themagistrates court, initial and enter a note of the record in abook kept for that purpose and thereupon the decision of thelay magistrate shall be deemed to be the decision of themagistrate and subsequent proceedings may accordingly betaken to enforce such fine or judgement.
